abstract.text: Returns the user’s preferred units for the given quantity types.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A set of
identifiers. These identifiers represent the quantity types to be examined. Before calling this method, your app must request read or share access to all the types in this set.
A block that this method calls as soon as it finishes looking up the preferred units. This block is passed the following parameters:
If the lookup is successful, this parameter contains a dictionary with
identifiers for the keys and
objects for the values. The keys match those passed to the
parameter. If an error occurs, this parameter is set to
preferredUnits
An error object. This method returns an error if the preferred units are inaccessible or if your app has not yet requested permission to access the quantity types; otherwise, this parameter is set to
error
This method runs asynchronously. As soon as it finishes looking up the preferred units, it calls the completion block on an anonymous background queue.
By default, the preferred units are based on the device’s current locale. For example, in the US, the preferred units for the
identifier are pounds. Other regions may use kilograms or stones. However, users can change their preferred units in the Health app at any time.
Your app should present HealthKit data using the current preferred units (see the
results identifier for an exception). You should also observe the
notification, and update the user interface whenever the user changes his or her preferred units.
The results returned by this method are based on your app’s permissions:
If you have never requested access for a type, this method returns an authorization not determined error.
If the user denied access to a type, this method returns the default units for the device’s current locale for that type.
If the user granted either read or share access, this method returns the current preferred units for that type (which may or may not be the default units).

abstract.text: Notifies observers whenever the user changes his or her preferred units.
Access and share health and fitness data while maintaining the user’s privacy and control.
The access point for all data managed by HealthKit.
Returns the user’s preferred units for the given quantity types.
A type that identifies samples that store numerical values.
A quantity sample type that measures the user’s blood glucose level.
A quantity sample type that measures the user’s weight.
A class for managing the units of measure within HealthKit.
Notifies observers whenever the user changes his or her preferred units.
Information about an error condition including a domain, a domain-specific error code, and application-specific information.
An unordered collection of unique elements.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
A type representing an error value that can be thrown.
